SELECT emp_name, MAX(salary) AS highest_salary FROM employees INNER JOIN payroll ON employees.emp_id = payroll.emp_id;

CREATE TABLE employees (
    emp_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    emp_name VARCHAR(50),
    emp_department VARCHAR(50),
    emp_position VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE payroll (
    payroll_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    emp_id INT,
    salary DECIMAL(10,2),
    payment_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (emp_id) REFERENCES employees(emp_id)
);

    attendance_id INT PRIMARY KEY,

    time_in TIME,
    time_out TIME,
    FOREIGN KEY (emp_id) REFERENCES employees(emp_id)
);

SELECT emp_id, emp_name FROM employees UNION SELECT emp_id, emp_name FROM payroll;

### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE employees (
 id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 name VARCHAR(50),
 department VARCHAR(50),
 hire_date DATE
);


CREATE TABLE payroll (
 id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 employee_id INT REFERENCES employees(id),
 salary DECIMAL(10, 2),
 pay_date DATE
);


CREATE TABLE attendance (
 id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 employee_id INT REFERENCES employees(id),
 check_in TIMESTAMP,
 check_out TIMESTAMP
);


CREATE TABLE time_off (
 id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 employee_id INT REFERENCES employees(id),
 start_date DATE,
 end_date DATE,
 reason VARCHAR(100)
);

### STATEMENT

SELECT e.name AS employee_name, t.start_date AS leave_start_date FROM employees e JOIN time_off t ON e.id = t.employee_id
